Comment: The game starts with a classical King pawns opening.
The game starts with a classical King pawns opening.
Typically this position leads to a Spanish opening, and sometimes an Italian opening.
Typically this position leads to a Spanish opening, and sometimes an Italian opening.
Leading towards an Italian opening.
Now I am presented with the choice of standard Italian or for a more challenging version, the Evans Gambit, a favorite of mine.
I want to improve my skills by playing the Evans which offers a lot of positional and strategic challenges.
The challenge is accepted.

There are a few typical responses (5...Ba5) maintains a pin on c3, but allows Qb3 with pressure on f7. (5...Bc5)  loses tempo after d2-d4, but does allow ...Na5. And finally the text move, which is considered the strongest response and allows ...Na5 to prevent an early attack on f7.

!? More usual is ...exd4, but the text move has some benefits of creating an off balance situation for white who now has to consider what to do about the attack on the bishop.

!? Not a guarantee of a win by any means, but this certainly creates a disruption for black who is encouraged to recapture with the king, a move which loses tempo by another check on the next move. This move was played in the adventurous spirit of the opening.
